intro: Aristotelea spiralis, commonly known as the spiral aristotelea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves along its stem. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are typical of the Araliaceae family. Its leaves are usually compound, with a feathery appearance, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Aristotelea spiralis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
